meanings.definition: The bony structure along the back of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The hedgehog's spines help protect it from predators.
meanings.sent2: I felt the spines of the porcupine when I touched it.
meanings.sent3: The cactus wished it could trade its spines for soft petals.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a sharpness that could rival the spines of a hedgehog.
meanings.sent5: The spines of the fish shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A sharp, pointed projection on a plant.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to prick yourself on the rose's spines.
meanings.sent2: The cactus spines are a natural defense mechanism.
meanings.sent3: The spines of the succulent plant looked like tiny daggers.
meanings.sent4: The thorns on the stem acted as spines, protecting the delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The spines of the cactus glistened with morning dew, making them look even more dangerous.

meanings.definition: The central part of a book binding.
meanings.sent1: The old book's spines were worn from years of use.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the spines of the antique books.
meanings.sent3: The library cat loved to nap on the warm spines of the books.
meanings.sent4: The spines of the books stood proudly on the shelf, showcasing their titles.
meanings.sent5: Running a finger along the spines of the books, she chose one to read.
